data.enText: money
a sum of money that is given as the first part of a larger payment

data.chText: 我们已支付了房款的5%作为订金。
data.enText: We've put down a 5% deposit on the house.

data.chText: 他们通常要求付100英镑（作为）订金。
data.enText: They normally ask you to pay £100 (as a) deposit.
a sum of money that is paid by sb when they rent sth and that is returned to them if they do not lose or damage the thing they are renting
to pay a deposit
a sum of money that is paid into a bank account

data.chText: 在任何一家分行都可以存钱。
data.enText: Deposits can be made at any branch.

data.chText: 竞选保证金（英国议员候选人预付，获得足够的票数则退还）
data.enText: (in the British political system) the amount of money that a candidate in an election to Parliament has to pay, and that is returned if he/she gets enough votes

data.chText: 所有其余候选人都失掉了竞选保证金。
data.enText: All the other candidates lost their deposits .
substance

data.chText: （地下自然形成的）沉积物，沉积层
data.enText: a layer of a substance that has formed naturally underground
mineral/gold/coal deposits

data.chText: （尤指河流、洪水、液体等的）沉积物，淤积物
data.enText: a layer of a substance that has been left somewhere, especially by a river, flood, etc., or is found at the bottom of a liquid

data.chText: 雨水在窗上留下一层泥。
data.enText: The rain left a deposit of mud on the windows.
fatty deposits in the arteries of the heart
put down
to put or lay sb/sth down in a particular place

data.chText: 她把一摞书放在我的书桌上。
data.enText: She deposited a pile of books on my desk.

data.chText: 一辆出租车匆匆把我送到旅馆外面，让我下了车。
data.enText: I was whisked off in a taxi and deposited outside the hotel.
leave substance

before.enText: especially of a river or a liquid

data.enText: to leave a layer of sth on the surface of sth, especially gradually and over a period of time

data.chText: 沙经沉积固结形成沙岩。
data.enText: Sand was deposited which hardened into sandstone.
money
to put money into a bank account

data.chText: 巨额款项存入了瑞士的银行账户。
data.enText: Millions were deposited in Swiss bank accounts.

data.chText: 付（订金）；付（保证金）；付（押金）
data.enText: to pay a sum of money as the first part of a larger payment; to pay a sum of money that you will get back if you return in good condition sth that you have rented
put in safe place
to put sth valuable or important in a place where it will be safe

data.chText: 旅客可将贵重物品寄存在旅馆的保险柜里。
data.enText: Guests may deposit their valuables in the hotel safe.

data.text: payment ♦ premium ♦ subscription ♦ repayment ♦ deposit ♦ instalment

data.chText: 以上各词均指款额、款项、付款。
data.enText: These are all words for an amount of money that you pay or are expected to pay, or for the act of paying.
payment
an amount of money that you pay or are expected to pay; the act of paying
ten monthly payments of $50
payment in advance
premium

data.chText: 指保险费、额外费用、附加费、溢价：
data.enText: an amount of money that you pay once or regularly for an insurance policy; an extra payment added to the basic rate; a higher amount of money than usual
an insurance premium
a premium for express delivery
subscription

data.chText: 指（报刊、杂志等的）订阅费、订购款，（服务的）用户费：
data.enText: an amount of money you pay in advance to receive regular copies of a newspaper or magazine or to receive a service
a subscription to ‘Newsweek’
repayment

data.chText: 指按期偿还的款项、分期偿还额、偿还债务、归还借款：
data.enText: an amount of money that you pay regularly to a bank, etc. until you have returned all the money that you owe; the act of paying this money
the repayments on the loan
deposit
an amount of money that you pay as the first part of a larger payment

data.chText: 我们已支付了房款的5%作为订金。
data.enText: We've put down a 5% deposit on the house.
instalment

data.chText: 指分期付款的一期付款：
data.enText: one of a number of payments that you make regularly over a period of time until you have paid for sth

data.chText: 我们以分期付款买了这辆车。
data.enText: We paid for the car by/in instalments.
The money was in payment/repayment of a debt.
(a/an) annual/monthly/regular/cash payment/premium/subscription/repayment/deposit/instalment
payment/repayment in full
to pay a(n) premium/subscription/deposit/instalment
to make (a) payment/repayment/deposit
to meet/keep up (with) (the) payment(s)/the premiums/(the) repayment(s)/the instalments

simple_means.memory_skill: de 向下 + posit 放，放置 → 放下不用 → 储存

tr: the act of putting something somewhere
a facility where things can be deposited for storage or safekeeping
a payment given as a guarantee that an obligation will be met
matter that has been deposited by some natural process
the phenomenon of sediment or gravel accumulating
money given as security for an article acquired for temporary use
example: his deposit was refunded when he returned the car

tr: a partial payment made at the time of purchase
the balance to be paid later
money deposited in a bank or some similar institution
the natural process of laying down a deposit of something

example: lodge a bullet in the table
stick your thumb in the crack
She posited her hand on his shoulder
deposit the suitcase on the bench
fix your eyes on this spot
She deposits her paycheck every month

value.def: A deposit is a sum of money which is part of the full price of something, and which you pay when you agree to buy it.

example.ex: A £50 deposit is required when ordering, and the balance is due upon delivery.
example.tran: 订货时需要交50英镑的订金，货到后余款结清。

value.def: A deposit is a sum of money which you pay when you start renting something. The money is returned to you if you do not damage what you have rented.

example.ex: It is common to ask for the equivalent of a month's rent as a deposit.
example.tran: 要求交一个月的房租作押金是很常见的。

value.def: A deposit is a sum of money which is in a bank account or savings account, especially a sum which will be left there for some time.

A deposit is a sum of money which you have to pay if you want to be a candidate in a parliamentary or European election. The money is returned to you if you receive more than a certain percentage of the votes.

example.ex: The Tory candidate lost his deposit.
example.tran: 这名托利党候选人连竞选保证金都搭进去了。

value.tran: 竞选保证金(参加议会或欧洲选举时提交，如获一定比例选票便可返还)

value.def: A deposit is an amount of a substance that has been left somewhere as a result of a chemical or geological process.

example.ex: After 10 minutes the surplus material is washed away and any remaining deposit examined with ultra violet light.
example.tran: 10分钟后剩余的物质被冲洗掉，任何残留的沉淀物则会用紫外线进行检测。

value.def: To deposit someone or something somewhere means to put them or leave them there.

example.ex: Someone was seen depositing a packet...
example.tran: 有人看见一个人放下了件小包裹。

example.ex: Fritz deposited a glass and two bottles of beer in front of Wolfe...
example.tran: 弗里茨把一个玻璃杯和两瓶啤酒放在沃尔夫面前。

example.ex: Imagine if you were suddenly swept up and deposited in Morocco. How well could you cope with the language, the weather, the people, and so on?
example.tran: 设想一下你突然被带走丢到了摩洛哥。你能多好地适应那里的语言、天气和人等等？

value.def: If you deposit something somewhere, you put it where it will be safe until it is needed again.

example.ex: You are advised to deposit valuables in the hotel safe.
example.tran: 建议把贵重物品存放在宾馆的保险箱里。

value.def: If you deposit a sum of money, you pay it into a bank account or savings account.

example.ex: The customer has to deposit a minimum of £100 monthly.
example.tran: 顾客必须每月至少存 100 英镑。

value.tran: 将（钱）存入银行（或储蓄）账户

value.def: If a substance is deposited somewhere, it is left there as a result of a chemical or geological process.

example.ex: The phosphate was deposited by the decay of marine microorganisms.
example.tran: 海洋微生物腐烂后沉积形成磷酸盐。

trans: 直接将工资转入银行账户

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to put, to place 放, 放置
rootsaffixes.title: pon, pound, pos(it)

partsOfSpeech.dec: ap 加强 + posit 放，放置 + e → 放到〔合适的位置〕→ 适当的
ap 表加强 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 放在〔一起〕→ 并置
com 共同 + pon 放，放置 + ent 具有…性质的，关于…的 → 共同放到一起 → 组成的
com 共同 + pos 放，放置 + e → 放到一起 → 组成
com 共同 + posit 放，放置 + e → 放到一起 → 合成物
com 共同 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 放到一起 → 组合 → 组合文字 → 作文
com 共同 + pos 放，放置 + ure 行为，行为的结果，与行为有关之物 → 共同放置〔危险品〕→ 沉着
com 共同 + pound 放，放置 → 都放到一起 → 化合物
de 向下 + pos 放，放置 + e → 下放；下沉 → 免职；沉淀
de 向下 + posit 放，放置 → 放下不用 → 储存
deposit 储存 + ary 场所 → 储藏室
dis 不 + compose 组成 → 使不安
dis 分开 + pos 放，放置 + e → 分开〔排好〕→ 排列
dis 分散 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 分开放 → 安排
ex 出 + pon 放，放置 + ent 表人 → 把〔内容〕讲出来 → 讲解者
ex 出 + pos 放，放置 + e → 放出来 → 暴露
ex 出 + posit 放，放置 + ion，expose 的名词 → 展览；解释
ex 出 + pound 放，放置 → 把〔意义〕说出来 → 详细说明
im 使… + pos 放，放置 + e → 强行放置 → 强加
im 使… + posit 放，放置 + ion，impose 的名词 → 征税；强加
im 进入 + pound 放，放置 → 放进去 → 把…围住；扣押
op 反 + pon 放，放置 + ent 具有…性质的 → 反着放 → 对立的
op 反 + posit 放，放置 + e → 放在对面 → 相对的
posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 放出的〔立场〕
posit 放，放置 + ive …的 → 放在那 → 肯定的
post 后 + pon 放，放置 + e → 向后放 → 推迟
pro 向前 + pon 放，放置 + e →〔把意见〕往前放 → 提议
propon〔e〕提议，提出 + ent 表人 → 提议者
pro 前 + pos 放，放置 + al 表行为 → 向前放 → 提议
pro 向前 + pound 放，放置 → 向前放 → 提出
pur 始终 + pos 放，放置 + e → 始终放不下的东西 → 目的
re 一再 + pos 放，放置 + e → 一再放下〔工作〕→ 休息
re 加强 + posit 放，放置 + ory 表地点 → 放东西之地 → 仓库
sup 下 + pos 放，放置 + e → 在下面提出 → 推测
sup 下 + posit 放，放置 + ion 表名词 → 推测
trans 转移 + pose 位置 →〔互相〕移放 → 互换位置
